001package io.github.ai4ci.functions;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004import java.util.Arrays;
005
006import org.immutables.value.Value;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnore;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonDeserialize;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonSerialize;
011
012import io.github.ai4ci.functions.Coordinates.DuplicateResolution;
013
014/**
015 * A simple empirical function defined by a set of (x,y) coordinates.
016 *
017 * <p>
018 * This interface describes a simple empirical function defined by a set of
019 * (x,y) coordinates. It includes parameters for interpolation and link function
020 * transformations. Implementations are used when defining empirical functions
021 * such as the age contact odds function in
022 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.AgeStratifiedDemography}.
023 *
024 * <p>
025 * Downstream uses include any place where an empirical function is required,
026 * such as the age contact odds function in
027 * {@link io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.AgeStratifiedDemography}. The default
028 * interpolation method is cubic spline, but other methods may be used if
029 * desired.
030 *
031 * @author Rob Challen
032 */
033@Value.Immutable
034@JsonSerialize(as = ImmutableEmpiricalFunction.class)
035@JsonDeserialize(as = ImmutableEmpiricalFunction.class)
036public interface EmpiricalFunction extends Serializable, SimpleFunction {
037
038        /**
039         * Compute the differential of the empirical function at a given X value.
040         * <p>
041         * This method computes the differential of the empirical function at a given
042         * X by applying the chain rule to the interpolated value and its derivative.
043         * It uses the derivative of the link function and the derivative of the
044         * interpolator to compute the overall differential at the specified X.
045         *
046         * @param x the X value at which to compute the differential of the empirical
047         *          function
048         * @return the differential of the empirical function at the specified X
049         */
050        @Override
051        default double differential(double x) {
052                return this.getLink()
053                        .derivInvFn(
054                                this.getInterpolator()
055                                        .interpolate(x)
056                        ) * this.getInterpolator()
057                                .differential(x);
058
059        }
060
061        /**
062         * The interpolation method used to interpolate between the (x,y)
063         * coordinates.
064         *
065         * @return the interpolation method used to interpolate between the (x,y)
066         *         coordinates
067         */
068        @Value.Default
069        default Interpolators getInterpolationType() {
070                return Interpolators.CUBIC_SPLINE;
071        }
072
073        /**
074         * The interpolator created from the coordinates and interpolation type.
075         * <p>
076         * This method constructs an interpolator based on the (x,y) coordinates and
077         * the specified interpolation type. It applies the link function to the Y
078         * coordinates before interpolation. The resulting interpolator can be used
079         * to compute interpolated values for any X within the range of the
080         * coordinates.
081         *
082         * @return the interpolator created from the coordinates and interpolation
083         *         type
084         */
085        @JsonIgnore @Value.Derived
086        default Interpolator getInterpolator() {
087
088                Coordinates tmp = ImmutableCoordinates.builder()
089                        .setX(this.getX())
090                        .setY(this.getY())
091                        .setXMin(this.getMinimum())
092                        .setXMax(this.getMaximum())
093                        .setXLink(LinkFunction.NONE)
094                        .setYLink(this.getLink())
095                        .setIncreasing(false)
096                        .setResolveDuplicates(DuplicateResolution.MEAN)
097                        .build();
098
099                return this.getInterpolationType()
100                        .create(tmp.getHx(), tmp.getHy());
101
102        }
103
104        /**
105         * The link function used to transform the Y coordinates before
106         * interpolation.
107         *
108         * @return the link function used to transform the Y coordinates before
109         *         interpolation
110         */
111        @Value.Default
112        default LinkFunction getLink() { return LinkFunction.NONE; }
113
114        /**
115         * The maximum X value of the empirical function, derived from the
116         * coordinates.
117         *
118         * @return the maximum X value of the empirical function
119         */
120        @Value.Default
121        default double getMaximum() {
122                return Arrays.stream(this.getX())
123                        .max()
124                        .getAsDouble();
125        }
126
127        /**
128         * The minimum X value of the empirical function, derived from the
129         * coordinates.
130         *
131         * @return the minimum X value of the empirical function
132         */
133        @Value.Default
134        default double getMinimum() {
135                return Arrays.stream(this.getX())
136                        .min()
137                        .getAsDouble();
138        }
139
140        /**
141         * The (x,y) coordinates defining the empirical function.
142         *
143         * @return the X coordinates defining the empirical function
144         */
145        double[] getX();
146
147        /**
148         * The (x,y) coordinates defining the empirical function.
149         *
150         * @return the Y coordinates defining the empirical function
151         */
152        double[] getY();
153
154        /**
155         * Evaluate the empirical function at a given X value.
156         * <p>
157         * This method computes the value of the empirical function at a given X by
158         * interpolating the Y values at the coordinates and then applying the
159         * inverse link function to the interpolated value. The result is the value
160         * of the empirical function at the specified X.
161         *
162         * @param x the X value at which to evaluate the empirical function
163         * @return the value of the empirical function at the specified X
164         *
165         */
166        @Override
167        default double value(double x) {
168                return this.getLink()
169                        .invFn(
170                                this.getInterpolator()
171                                        .interpolate(Interpolator.squish(getMinimum(), x, getMaximum()))
172                        );
173        }
174
175}
